generalfeedback.text:
Worked solution

  • Primary Data: This is data that you collect yourself for a specific purpose. It is "fresh" and original. (Examples: Counting cars, interviewing people, measuring height).
  • Secondary Data: This is data that someone else has already collected. You are just using it. (Examples: Census reports, newspaper articles, textbooks, internet searches).
